Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery heavy chalice, with part of handle zone between roots; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: slip partly worn; trace of black band; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ7
Curator's comments: ɸ7 and 107 are written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. Bands on the cul of chalices appears as early as 610BC and last until circa 550BC. Chalice kraters however, are found in the Mature Animal Style and Grand Styles. The sherd joins 1965,0930.40 and 1888,0601.193; 1965,0930.19 and 171 are probably from the same chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1618) (phase 2)
